Title:
Senior Manager of Business Development - Capture & Solutions Architect

KBR Is seeking a Sr. Manager of Business Development - Capture & Solutions Architect (Operations) to join the Government Solutions US - Defense Systems Engineering, Naval Solutions Division. The selected candidate will lead a diverse team of professionals supporting domestic and international customers. Candidates should be prepared to excel in a fast-paced, multicultural environment. The KBR Naval Solutions (NS) Division family is a cadre of high-performing, professional teammates who deserve leadership invested in their success. This is a flexible Hybrid/Remote role; travel required- 10%.

KBRs Defense Systems Engineering (DSE) business unit provides technical, engineering, and scientific solutions to the Department of Defense for missions that matter. We are looking for a high-energy, respected leader who is well-versed in government contracting and capable of leading the growth of the companys Naval Solutions (NS) Division.

This senior management position will directly report to the Naval Solutions Vice President, with tangential reporting to the DSE Business Development Vice President. This position is responsible for developing and executing the divisions growth strategy, including coordinating all recapture activities (Keeping It Sold) and leading all IDIQ task order development under a Four Disciplines of Execution (4DX) process. The successful candidate will interact directly with each of the Naval Solutions Operating Unit Directors and other functional support business partners in a matrixed organization.

As a Sr. Manager of Business Development - Capture & Solutions Architect, the successful candidate will conceptualize, develop, communicate, and propose solutions to drive growth and lead directly to top and bottom-line results. The successful candidate will work with clients in both a long-lead and tactical capacity to help solve their critical needs and challenges and help define client requirements for solutions, including services, products, technologies, and capabilities encompassing related engineering and scientific disciplines.

RESPONSIBILITIES FOR THIS POSITION WILL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO:
Develop and execute growth strategies for DSE that result in above-target revenue, operating income, and operating margin. Lead Business Development for an organization that provides systems engineering, acquisition support, digital engineering, DEVSECOPS, prototyping, integration, and support services primarily focused on Navy domestic and FMS (Foreign Military Sales) customers. Lead an integrated, high-performing BD organization working in close partnership with operational and functional teams. Lead the development and implementation of a successful growth strategy across the Naval Solutions (NS) portfolio. Lead development and sustainment of re-competes and new business development. Act as a solutions architect for Naval Solutions (NS) capture efforts. Provide strategy, win themes, and solutions to increase the Proposal Win (Pwin) of opportunities. Lead an organization to achieve target new business and recompete win rates. Develop and sustain strategic relations with key customers, competitors, and teammates.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's degree plus 15 years of experience in operational/business development capacity or 20 years of successful capture experience in lieu of degree. Proposal experience leading development for DoD (Department of Defense) proposal responses. Strong familiarity with FAR-based procurements for highly technical services, solutions, and products for task order and single-award contract procurement approaches. Demonstrated experience conducting and facilitating proposal value propositions, Color Team Reviews, direct customer engagements, and capture strategy meetings. Experience in strategy development and execution, leading to crucial market penetration and growth in key market share. Experience and success winning large, complex government engineering, IT, or mission support programs based on the Shipley proposal development management process. The ability to obtain a national security secret clearance. Experience using Salesforce Systems. Strong writing skills.

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE:
Masters Degree (Technical or Business/Management) Deep mission domain familiarity with Navy systems and customers. Experience leveraging Business Intelligence data to inform business strategy using data analytics, ML, or AI. Prior success in growing a DoD business combining successful retention of the base, execution of key take-away opportunities, and progressive engagement resulting in sustained growth in re-capture value with key customers. Demonstrated understanding and experience working with a capture team creating winning Defense Technical Information Center (DTIC), OASIS, and FEDSIM proposals.

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40 hours/week

Relocation: KBR does offer relocation assistance to qualified candidates

Additional Compensation: KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of a sign-on bonus, relocation benefits, short-term incentives, long-term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

Benefits + More

When you become part of the KBR team, your career opportunities are endless. Our people are the heart of everything we do here at KBR. We Value our People!

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits, which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

At KBR, we are passionate about our people, sustainability, and our Zero Harm culture. These ideals form all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward, being a more inclusive and diverse company. That commitment is central to our team of teams philosophy and fosters an environment of real collaboration across cultures and locations. Our individual differences and perspectives bring enhanced value to our teams and help us develop solutions for the most challenging problems. We understand that by embracing those differences and working together, we are more innovative, more resilient, and safer. We Deliver Together.

About Us

KBR Delivering Solutions, Changing the World.

KBR brings together the best and brightest to deliver science, technology and engineering solutions that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

In everything we do, we are guided by our ONE KBR Values:

We Value Our People We create diverse, inclusive environments in which each person can feel safe, respected and valued, and where everyone has opportunities to grow and reach their full potential.

We Deliver We are uncompromising in our commitment to deliver innovative, high-quality, technology-led solutions for our customers and exceptional, sustainable value for all our stakeholders.

We Are People of Integrity We value honesty, trust, courage, fairness, prudence and tenacity. We believe doing whats right for the planet, the communities where we work, and our people is good for business.

We Empower We empower our people with a shared purpose, the right tools and the supportive culture they need to be proactive decision-makers, to be adaptive to change, and to succeed.

We Are a Team of Teams We have a will to succeed, but we value the achievements of our team of teams over individual accomplishments. Our collective focus makes us a better, stronger, more effective company.

We have also embedded environmental, social and governance (ESG) principles in every business operation and corporate function. Not only are we committed to operating safely, sustainably and equitably, but we are also committed to using our capabilities and expertise to help our customers accomplish their sustainability goals.

Worldwide, KBR employs a diverse workforce approximately 29,000 people strong, with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in 40 countries.

At KBR, We Deliver.

Fraud has infiltrated the job placement market via the internet, email and direct phone contact. Attempts have included unauthorized use of KBRs name and logo to solicit potential job seekers or to extend false job offers. Bad actors may mix in fake job advertisements with legitimate postings. These ads can include contact instructions and require job seekers to send sensitive personal information or money to pay for visa applications, processing fees, etc., in exchange for consideration for a high-paying position.

KBR will never ask for any sort of advance payment as part of the recruiting/hiring process. Candidate profiles are carefully managed to protect personal information.
